awd_titl_txt: Magnetostratigraphy of African Early Hominid Cave Sites
awd_abstract_narration: This project will provide a thorough magnetostratigraphic                  study of cores from sedimentary deposits at three classic hominid               cave sites in South Africa (Makapansgat, Sterkfontein, and                      Taung).  The proposed research should result in the production of               dates for some of these sites.                                                                                                                                       Knowledge of the magnetic polarity of archaeological                       deposits is an important factor in developing an accurate time                  scale and thus in dating the fossils accurately.  The South                     African hominid-bearing cave deposits have a very complicated                   stratigraphy and thus the temporal placement of these fossils has               been difficult to resolve.  The application of this modern                      technique will be a major contribution to our understanding of                  the timing and duration of previous events at these cave sites.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
